In order to continue connecting the population of the Amazon, the Ministry of Transport and Communications (MTC) will begin during the second quarter of next year the execution of the balance of work for the improvement of the Quistococha-Zungarococha-Llanchama highway, located in the district of San Juan Bautista, in the province of Maynas, Loreto region.

This work includes the improvement of 11.48 km of road at the level of the asphalt layer, in addition to the construction of three bridges, slab type, with lengths ranging between 10 and 25 meters.

The new Quistococha-Llanchama highway will benefit more than one hundred thousand people in the San Juan Bautista district, as well as the surrounding communities, as they will be able to connect with the Iquitos-Nauta departmental highway, which will facilitate accessibility to the main markets of the city , health centers and other public services.

The preparation of the record of the balance of this work is in charge of Prov?as Descentralizado, the executing unit of the MTC, and is carried out through direct administration. To this end, a group of specialists from said entity is carrying out the last coordination in order for the technical file to be completed and approved at the end of this year.

Prov?as Descentralizado reaffirms its commitment to continue working to provide a good road infrastructure to the Loreto region and, in this way, improve the quality of life of thousands of Peruvians.
